results.title: M Comme Mathieu = M as in Mathieu
results.brief_description:
Mathieu is just out of a convalescing home and resumes life at home with wife Jeanne. His mental health is still unstable and he cannot control his obsession for Muriel, an imaginary woman who looks just like Jeanne.

Credits: Producer, Bob Zagury ; director, Jean-Francois Adam ; writer, Jean-Francois Adam ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Sami Frey, Brigitte Fossey, Roland Dubillard, Bulle Ogier, Laurent Mirouze.

results.title: Luz
results.brief_description: 128…129…129…a walk through a wondrous neighbourhood that only a child could imagine. A little girl plays in the street while her mother calls her home, wherever we find it.

results.title: Luxembourg
results.brief_description: Brief travelogue describing Luxembourg, capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Shows typical street scenes, the market in the main square - the Place Guillaume, the Palace of the Grand Duchess and nearby Mondorf-les-Bains famous for its spa waters, the Caisse d’Epargne, the famous bridge - the Pont Adolphe.

results.title: Luther Metke at 94
results.creator_credit: Steve Raymen, Jorge Preloran, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program
results.brief_description: A portrait of Luther Metke who has lived in this Cascade Mountains of Oregon since 1907. Tells how he was a veteran of the Spanish American War, an early labor organiser, a poet, and a builder, and today serves as a vital and lucid example of the rural ethic in America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Raymen, Jorge Preloran, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program

results.title: Lungs
results.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Morgan and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: Discusses the structure, function and mechanism of the lungs. The overall structure of the lungs and air passage is presented by means of a sheep dissection and a living lung is seen during a routine operationat a veterinary clinic. The movement of the diaphragm and ribs is clearly highlighted by X-ray.

results.title: Luke's Party
results.brief_description: A young woman sits herself in front of a video camera to document her struggles as a single mother. By the time she has finished dealing with her bills, her children’s demands, her best friend’s questions and trying to arrange her son’s birthday, we understand only too well how difficult life can be. A very funny and very affectionate look at working class urban life.

results.title: Low impact technology: solar heating
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Experiments with solar energy have been carried out for many years, especially domestic solar hot water and heating systems. Architects, and scientists from the CSIRO and the University of Melbourne comment on the types and requirements of today’s solar heating systems, and how they can be used domestically and industrially. Photography by John Ruane.

results.title: Low back pain
results.brief_description: Looks at the subject of low back pain and injuries. Discusses causes, including lack of exercise and tension and treatment, which includes relaxation and appropriate exercise.

results.title: Love Della
results.brief_description: This is a 50’s home movie style portrait of a fictional 19 year old, undiscovered jazz starlet, called Della Ray ( Kate Cebrano).Though recently shot, the film masquerades convincingly as found footage of a 50’s jazz club and its inhabitants. It begins with a roller coaster jam session featuring unknown local musicians of 1958, and ends with an impromptu number by the delightful Delia herself, who “died” in the tradition of thejazz greats, shortly after the footage was shot. Features excellent original 50’s jazz numbers.
